subject: Sexual Health
title: Stages of Fetal Growth
description: A micro-lesson that makes Stages of Fetal Growth usable.

hook.text: From the size of a poppy seed to a full-term baby, fetal growth follows a precise timetable.

buildup.text: The first trimester builds organs. The second adds size and movement. The third packs on weight.

discovery.text: By week 20 the fetus can hear sounds. By week 28 it can open its eyes and respond to light.

twist.text: A baby born at 24 weeks can survive with medical help, but every extra week in the womb matters.

climax.text: At 40 weeks, the average newborn weighs about 7.5 pounds, billions of times its original cell weight.

punchline.text: Nine months: from a speck to a person.

quiz.question: When can a fetus first hear sounds?
